channel.title: Webcomic on Homepage
channel.description: Recent content in Webcomic on Homepage

item.title: The Best Style is No-Template Style
item.description: IMPORTANT UPDATE:  Due to an undocumented limit on Squarespace’s Archive List block, the current solution will not work with >1000 comics in the archive. If your comic archives are more than 1000, or you will reach it soon, please find another solution. I’m sorry to have launched with this limitation, but I didn’t have an archive with 1000 entries to test on and it wasn’t documented, so I wasn’t aware of it.
item.content:encoded: IMPORTANT UPDATE:  Due to an undocumented limit on Squarespace’s Archive List block, the current solution will not work with >1000 comics in the archive. If your comic archives are more than 1000, or you will reach it soon, please find another solution. I’m sorry to have launched with this limitation, but I didn’t have an archive with 1000 entries to test on and it wasn’t documented, so I wasn’t aware of it.

item.title: template-less
item.description: The No-Template Style I’ve gotten some feedback on my webcomic template for Squarespace, and the two biggest complaints are that the $18 per month developer account is too expensive, and the template is too hard to customize for someone with no coding skills whatsoever. Since I released the template, Squarespace has made a couple updates to their platform that have allowed me to publish a new solution that doesn’t require a custom template.
item.content:encoded: The No-Template Style I’ve gotten some feedback on my webcomic template for Squarespace, and the two biggest complaints are that the $18 per month developer account is too expensive, and the template is too hard to customize for someone with no coding skills whatsoever. Since I released the template, Squarespace has made a couple updates to their platform that have allowed me to publish a new solution that doesn’t require a custom template.
